welcome.title: Welcome to TradeBlazer
welcome.description: Welcome aboard! TradeBlazer is a friendly and easy-to-use platform for buying and selling financial assets like stocks, cryptocurrencies, and currencies. Whether you're completely new to trading or have some experience, we're here to guide you every step of the way.

step1.title: Step 1: Sign Up
step1.description: Simply enter your email and create a password. We keep things simple so you can start exploring right away!

step2.title: Step 2: Complete Your Profile
step2.description: Add your name and preferences. This helps us personalize your trading experience.

whatYouCanDo.title: What You Can Do on TradeBlazer
whatYouCanDo.description: Here are the main things you can do on our platform:

quickTips.title: Beginner Tips
quickTips.tip1: Start with the "Website Navigation" tutorial to learn how to use our platform
quickTips.tip2: Begin with small amounts until you feel comfortable with trading
quickTips.tip3: Use the Demo mode to practice without using real money
quickTips.tip4: Don't hesitate to contact our support team if you need help!

dashboard.title: Dashboard Overview
dashboard.description: The Dashboard is TradeBlazer's central hub. From here, you can quickly access all important information and features.

marketOverview.title: Market Overview
marketOverview.description: A comprehensive look at financial markets including popular assets and the latest market trends.

yourPortfolio.title: Your Portfolio
yourPortfolio.description: Track the value, profit, and performance of your investments in one place.

watchlist.title: Watchlist
watchlist.description: Keep an eye on your favorite assets and get notifications about price changes.

recentActivity.title: Recent Activity
recentActivity.description: View your recent transactions and account activity for quick reference.

mainMenu.title: Main Menu
mainMenu.description: Use the main menu at the top of the page to navigate the platform. Here's an overview of the different pages and features:

table.homeDescription: Return to the main dashboard for a comprehensive overview.
table.marketsDescription: Browse available assets and see detailed information about them.
table.portfolioDescription: Manage your positions and track your investment performance.
table.watchlistDescription: Manage your list of watched assets and set up alerts.
table.profileDescription: Manage your account settings and personal information.

step1.title: Select an Asset
step1.description: Browse the Markets page or use the search to find your desired asset.

step2.title: Analyze the Asset
step2.description: Examine price history, market trends, and information about the asset before making a trading decision.

step3.title: Create a Trade Order
step3.description: Choose the quantity you want, set the order type (market, limit), and click 'Place Order'.

step4.title: Manage Your Position
step4.description: Track your positions from the Portfolio page and make appropriate decisions based on market changes.

depositingFunds.title: Depositing Funds
depositingFunds.description: Click on the 'Deposit' button in the Profile page and follow the steps to increase your balance.

withdrawingFunds.title: Withdrawing Funds
withdrawingFunds.description: Select 'Withdraw' from the Profile page, enter the amount and your banking details to make a withdrawal.

gettingHelp.title: Getting Help
gettingHelp.description: You can ask for help through multiple channels anytime:

whatAreMarkets.title: What Are Markets?
whatAreMarkets.description: Financial markets are platforms where various financial instruments are traded, including stocks, cryptocurrencies, currencies, and commodities. These markets connect buyers and sellers, enabling trading and price discovery.

table.stocksDescription: Securities representing ownership pieces of companies.
table.cryptocurrenciesDescription: Digital or virtual currencies that are secured by cryptography.
table.forexDescription: The exchange of one country's currency for another.

buyingSelling.title: Buying and Selling
buyingSelling.description: The foundation of trading is buying assets at a low price and selling them at a higher price (or vice versa for shorting).

priceMovements.title: Price Movements
priceMovements.description: Asset prices change based on supply and demand, market sentiment, news, and various economic factors.

orderTypes.title: Order Types
orderTypes.description: Market orders execute immediately at the current price, while limit orders only execute at a specified price or better.

riskManagement.title: Risk Management
riskManagement.description: Traders use stop-loss orders and only risk a portion of their capital on individual trades.

profitLoss.title: Understanding Profit and Loss

profitExample.title: Profitable Trade Example
profitExample.step3: 3. You sell the BTC at the new price

lossExample.title: Loss-making Trade Example
lossExample.step3: 3. You sell the shares at the new price

profitLoss.reminder: Remember: All trading involves risk. Never risk more than you can afford to lose.

question1.title: How much money do I need to start?
question1.answer: You can start trading with small amounts on TradeBlazer. We recommend beginning with an amount that you'd be comfortable losing.

question2.title: How long does it take to learn trading?
question2.answer: Learning to trade is an ongoing process. You'll need to spend time understanding the basics, starting with small investments, and gradually building your knowledge.

question3.title: Do I need special qualifications to trade?
question3.answer: No special qualifications or degrees are required, but you need to understand financial basics, markets, and analytical tools.

question4.title: Where can I find more educational materials?
question4.answer: We offer regular webinars, detailed guides, and tutorial videos on the TradeBlazer platform. You might also want to check out finance books and online courses.

advancedTools.title: Advanced Tools
advancedTools.description: Learn about advanced trading tools that can help you make better decisions in the market.

movingAverages.title: Moving Averages
movingAverages.description: Moving averages show the average price over a specific period, helping identify trends and potential support/resistance levels.

rsi.title: Relative Strength Index (RSI)
rsi.description: RSI is a momentum oscillator that measures the speed and change of price movements, indicating overbought or oversold conditions.

chartPatterns.title: Chart Patterns
chartPatterns.description: Chart patterns are shapes that appear on price charts and can help predict future price movements.

uptrend.title: Uptrend
uptrend.description: A series of higher lows and higher highs, indicating an overall rise in prices.

downtrend.title: Downtrend
downtrend.description: A series of lower highs and lower lows, indicating an overall decline in prices.

stopLoss.title: Stop Loss
stopLoss.description: An order that automatically closes your position at a predetermined price level, limiting potential loss.

takeProfit.title: Take Profit
takeProfit.description: A preset order that automatically closes your position at a profit when the price reaches your target price.

tips.title: Tips for Advanced Users
tips.tip1: Always use stop-loss orders to limit potential losses.
tips.tip2: Remember that technical analysis is a tool, not a guarantee.
tips.tip3: Practice on a demo account before trading with real money.
tips.tip4: Divergences (when indicators and price move in opposite directions) can be powerful signals.
tips.tip5: Diversify your trades across different assets to reduce risk.

portfolioManagement.title: Portfolio Management
portfolioManagement.description: Portfolio management is more than just buying and selling assets. This section introduces the basics of investment management.

dontPutAllEggs.title: Don't Put All Your Eggs in One Basket
dontPutAllEggs.description: Combining different types of investments can reduce risk and improve long-term results.

lowRisk.title: Low Risk
lowRisk.description: Generally lower returns but greater safety. Examples: government bonds, money market funds.

mediumRisk.title: Medium Risk
mediumRisk.description: Balanced risk and return. Examples: blue-chip stocks, quality corporate bonds.

highRisk.title: High Risk
highRisk.description: Higher potential returns but greater possibility of loss. Examples: small-cap stocks, cryptocurrencies.

regularCheckups.title: Regular Checkups
regularCheckups.description: Review your investments at least once a year to ensure they still align with your goals.

lifeChanges.title: Life Changes
lifeChanges.description: Marriage, having children, or approaching retirement can affect your risk tolerance and investment horizon.

rebalancing.title: Rebalancing
rebalancing.description: If some investments outperform others, your portfolio balance can become skewed. Rebalancing restores your desired balance.

tips.title: Portfolio Management Tips
tips.tip1: Start by defining long-term goals before purchasing any investment.
tips.tip2: Diversify not just across assets but also across industries and regions.
tips.tip3: Don't overreact to short-term market movements; stick to your strategy.
tips.tip4: Use dollar-cost averaging - invest regularly regardless of market conditions.
tips.tip5: Consider tax implications when making investment decisions.

marketAnalysis.title: Market Analysis
marketAnalysis.description: Market analysis helps you understand underlying factors that affect asset prices and market trends.

fundamental.title: Fundamental Analysis
fundamental.description: Examining corporate finances, economic indicators, and market conditions to determine an asset's intrinsic value.
fundamental.like: It's like examining a car's engine and mechanical condition before buying it.

technical.title: Technical Analysis
technical.description: Examining price charts and statistical data to forecast future price movements based on past patterns.
technical.like: It's like analyzing weather patterns to create a forecast.

companyNews.title: Company News
companyNews.description: Corporate announcements, quarterly results, and major developments can significantly impact stock prices.

tradingVolume.title: Trading Volume
tradingVolume.description: High volume shows there's strong interest in an asset, while low volume indicates lower interest.

marketTrends.title: Market Trends
marketTrends.description: The general direction of the market helps understand the broader environment in which a particular asset operates.

industryChanges.title: Industry Changes
industryChanges.description: Changes affecting an entire industry often impact all related companies.

readingCharts.title: Reading Charts
readingCharts.description: Charts are visual tools that display historical prices and volumes in an easy-to-understand format.

candlesticks.title: Candlestick Charts
candlesticks.description: These charts show the opening, closing, high, and low prices for a period, helping interpret market sentiment.

patterns.title: Common Patterns
patterns.description: Certain price patterns, such as 'head and shoulders' or 'double bottom', can provide useful signals about future price movements.

step1.title: Step 1: Analyze General Market Conditions
step1.description: Start by understanding the broader market environment - economic signals, market sentiment, and macroeconomic factors.

step2.title: Step 2: Industry Analysis
step2.description: Evaluate the health and trends of the industry in which the asset operates, including growth potential and challenges.

step3.title: Step 3: Individual Analysis
step3.description: Examine specific asset metrics, competitive position, and valuation metrics.

step4.title: Step 4: Technical Analysis as a Supplement
step4.description: Use price charts and technical indicators to determine timing and entry points.

mistakes.title: Common Beginner Mistakes
mistakes.mistake1: Overconfidence in analysis - always remember markets can be unpredictable.
mistakes.mistake2: Spending too much time analyzing irrelevant information instead of focusing on key factors.
mistakes.mistake3: Not following broader economic changes that can affect all assets.
mistakes.mistake4: Overreacting to short-term noise and ignoring longer-term trends.
mistakes.mistake5: Using only one method of analysis - stronger analysis combines fundamental and technical approaches.
mistakes.reminder: Remember: Success in market analysis comes from continuous learning and integrating different perspectives.

commonMistakes.title: Common Mistakes
commonMistakes.tip1: Overreacting to short-term news or price movements.
commonMistakes.tip2: Using too many indicators, which can be confusing and give contradictory signals.
commonMistakes.tip3: Letting emotions drive decisions instead of data-based analysis.
commonMistakes.tip4: Relying on only one type of analysis instead of a more complete picture.
commonMistakes.tip5: Neglecting risk management while overemphasizing potential returns.

about.title: About TradeBlazer
about.description: We are a small indie company who worked hard on this project. We faced many challenges but were determined to complete it successfully. Your support helps us maintain and improve our platform.

watchlist.login: Please log in to view your watchlist

deposit.title: Deposit Funds
deposit.feeInfo: Fees may apply depending on the method.

hero.title: Master the Markets
hero.subtitle: Join thousands of traders on the most comprehensive trading platform with built-in education and analysis tools

learningPlatform.title: Learning Platform
learningPlatform.description: Master trading with our structured courses, from basics to advanced strategies

security.title: Enterprise Security
security.description: Protected by military-grade encryption and real-time fraud detection systems

analysis.title: Live Analysis
analysis.description: Access real-time market data and advanced technical analysis tools

multiAsset.title: Multi-Asset Trading
multiAsset.description: Trade stocks, crypto, and forex from a single unified platform

education.title: Learn as You Trade
education.description: Access our comprehensive learning platform with interactive courses, live workshops, and real-world trading simulations. Perfect for both beginners and advanced traders

joinNow.title: Start Your Trading Journey Today
joinNow.subtitle: Join thousands of traders who have already chosen TradeBlazer as their preferred trading platform
